page.title: 09INDUSTRY - FISHING POEM
page.content:
Here is part of a poem written by the pupils:
Clark and Fairnie, Bruce and Ritchie Brown, Hogg, Tait and Hay Falconer and Scott, Ross and Findlay Thorburn, Miller, Sinclair and Watt Fleming and Reid, Geddes and Slater Thomson, Anderson, Manson and Murray Skinner and Fairbairn, Harkess and Wood Crawford, Mackenzie, Donaldson, McBay Names o' our fisher folk that's a' Halibut,turbot,trout and sprat redfish,flatfish,and fish like that whiting and herring, our own silver darlings haddock and cod, salmon and dab winkles,and cockles,mussels and whelks
